questions.question: I have not been well ……………….. I returned from Bangkok.
questions.description: We use since to reckon from a point of time in the past.

questions.question: No sooner did he see the policeman …………………. he disappeared.
questions.description: We use than after no sooner.

questions.question: Everyone rose to their feet ……………………… the chief guest entered the room.
questions.description: We can use ‘as’ to talk about two events that happen simultaneously.

questions.question: Don’t talk ………………………… she is singing.
questions.description: We can use while to introduce a longer background action which is going on when something else happens.

questions.question: …………………… I get older, I get happier.
questions.description: As is often used with simple tenses to talk about situations that develop / change together.

questions.question: They were ordered to wait ……………………….. the signal was given.
questions.description: Till indicates time. Unless indicates a condition.

questions.question: Write it down …………………….. you should forget about it.
questions.description: Lest can introduce an adverb clause of purpose.

questions.question: They spoke in a low voice ……………………….. the child wouldn’t wake up.
questions.description: So that can indicate the purpose.

questions.question: He thinks that he can buy justice ………………………. he is rich.
questions.description: We use because to indicate the reason.

questions.question: I will not pay ………………………. he sends me the bill again.
questions.description: Unless indicates a condition. It is similar to if not.

questions.question: ……………………. I had not seen this with my own eyes, I would not have believed it.
questions.description: We use if to express a condition.

questions.question: ………………………. you are very clever, you should be able to solve this puzzle.
questions.description: Since indicates the reason for something.
